<info added on 2025-08-05T13:31:47.121Z>
Architecture validation and documentation have been completed.

Completed actions:
1. Analyzed current structure and confirmed all domain modules adhere well to Hexagonal Architecture principles.
2. Identified duplicate modules (e.g., popupmoah-popupstore-*) and unused modules.
3. Created architecture documentation:
   - ARCHITECTURE_VALIDATION_REPORT.md: Detailed validation report
   - IMPROVED_SETTINGS_GRADLE.md: Proposed improved module structure
   - ARCHITECTURE_DIAGRAM.md: Architecture diagram and dependency rules

Validation results:
- 85% compliance with Hexagonal Architecture principles
- Clear module boundaries established
- High MSA readiness (85%)
- Correct dependency direction

Issues found:
- Duplicate modules exist (e.g., popupmoah-popupstore-*)
- Missing plugins/repositories sections in some build.gradle files
- Duplicate dependencies (Spring Boot starter overlap)

Recommendations:
1. Remove duplicate modules
2. Clean up build.gradle files
3. Centralize dependency management
4. Complete MSA migration preparation

Next step: Proceed with duplicate module removal and dependency cleanup.
</info added on 2025-08-05T13:31:47.121Z>

subtasks.title: Implement Popup Store Location Markers
subtasks.description: Display popup store locations as markers on the integrated maps using data from the backend.
subtasks.details:
Fetch popup store coordinates from the backend, plot them as markers on both KakaoMap and NaverMap, and ensure marker info windows show relevant store details.
<info added on 2025-09-07T06:12:42.312Z>
# Popup Store Location Marker Implementation Completed

## Backend Implementation
- Added coordinate information to PopupStore entity (latitude, longitude, address)
- Implemented coordinate-related methods (hasCoordinates, setCoordinates, setAddress)
- Updated DTO classes (CreateRequest, UpdateRequest, Response)
- Created PopupStoreLocationResponse DTO optimized for map display
- Added location API endpoints to PopupStoreController:
  - GET /api/popupstores/locations: All popup store locations
  - GET /api/popupstores/locations/active: Active popup store locations only

## Frontend Implementation
- Created PopupStoreMap.vue component
  - Integrated MapViewer
  - Implemented popup store marker display
  - Added info panel on marker click
  - Implemented detail view and directions functionality
- Integrated map view into popup store listing page
  - Added list/map view toggle
  - Implemented store selection and detail view from map
  - Applied responsive design

## Key Features
- Popup store location markers display
- Store information display on marker click
- Toggle between map and list views
- Option to show only active popup stores
- Current location-based map centering
- Directions functionality (KakaoMap integration)
</info added on 2025-09-07T06:12:42.312Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that all popup stores appear as markers and info windows display correct information.

subtasks.title: Configure and Integrate Redis for Caching
subtasks.description: Set up Redis server, add necessary dependencies, and configure Redis integration in the Spring Boot application for caching.
subtasks.details: Install Redis, add 'spring-boot-starter-data-redis' dependency, configure Redis connection settings, and create RedisConfig class using Lettuce for thread safety.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify Redis connection and ensure RedisTemplate is properly initialized.

subtasks.title: Implement Spring Cache Annotations and Cache Strategy
subtasks.description: Enable caching in the application and apply @Cacheable, @CachePut, and @CacheEvict annotations to appropriate service methods.
subtasks.details: Add @EnableCaching to the main application class, identify cacheable methods, and define cache names and keys for efficient data retrieval.
subtasks.testStrategy: Test cache hits and misses by monitoring method invocations and Redis cache entries.

subtasks.title: Optimize Database Queries for Performance
subtasks.description: Analyze and refactor slow or inefficient database queries to reduce latency and improve overall system performance.
subtasks.details: Profile query execution, add necessary indexes, rewrite complex queries, and minimize N+1 query issues using JPA best practices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Benchmark query performance before and after optimization; validate correctness of results.

subtasks.title: Integrate Image CDN for Static Asset Delivery
subtasks.description: Configure and connect an image CDN to serve static image assets, reducing server load and improving response times.
subtasks.details: Select a suitable CDN provider, update image URLs to use CDN endpoints, and ensure cache headers are set for optimal delivery.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify image loading speed and CDN cache effectiveness using browser developer tools and CDN analytics.

subtasks.title: Conduct Performance Testing and Cache Effectiveness Validation
subtasks.description: Perform comprehensive performance tests to measure the impact of caching and CDN integration, and validate cache hit ratios.
subtasks.details: Use tools like JMeter or Gatling to simulate load, monitor Redis and CDN metrics, and analyze system throughput and latency.
subtasks.testStrategy: Compare performance metrics before and after optimization; ensure cache and CDN are functioning as intended.

subtasks.title: Write Unit Tests for Core Modules
subtasks.description: Develop comprehensive unit tests for all critical modules and services to ensure individual components function as expected.
subtasks.details: Identify core modules, select appropriate testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit for Java), and implement unit tests covering key logic and edge cases.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify test coverage meets project standards and all unit tests pass in isolation.

subtasks.title: Implement Integration Tests
subtasks.description: Create integration tests to validate interactions between multiple modules and external dependencies such as databases or APIs.
subtasks.details: Design test cases that simulate real-world data flows and module interactions, ensuring correct integration and data consistency.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run integration tests in a controlled environment and confirm successful data exchange and error handling.

subtasks.title: Develop End-to-End (E2E) Tests
subtasks.description: Write E2E tests to simulate user workflows and verify the system operates correctly from the user's perspective.
subtasks.details: Utilize tools like Selenium or Cypress to automate user scenarios, covering critical paths and edge cases across the application.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute E2E tests in a staging environment and ensure all user journeys complete without errors.

subtasks.title: Configure GitHub Actions for CI Pipeline
subtasks.description: Set up GitHub Actions workflows to automate building, testing, and validating code on each push or pull request.
subtasks.details: Create workflow YAML files to define jobs for code checkout, dependency installation, build, and running all test suites.
subtasks.testStrategy: Confirm that CI workflows trigger on code changes and all automated tests pass before merging.

subtasks.title: Establish CD Pipeline with GitHub Actions
subtasks.description: Extend GitHub Actions workflows to automate deployment to the target environment upon successful CI completion.
subtasks.details: Integrate deployment steps (e.g., Docker build/push, server deployment) and manage secrets for secure deployments.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate that deployments occur automatically after successful CI runs and the application is accessible in the target environment.
